page.title: 09SOCIAL CONCERNS-CHANGES
page.content: The village has changed greatly over the past ten years,mainly because of the large housing estate which has been built.The population has risen to almost nine hundred and now the village has softball,football and netball teams, a squash club,a juinor club and a Brownie pack.The village shop closed down in 1983 because the owner Mr Waller retired .No one took over the Post Office part of the shop, and it is greatly missed.The old peaple have to go to St Neots to collect there pensions and they miss the food it sold, like bread, milk, cheese, etc.The children,too, miss the shop beacause they enjoyed going to shop for sweets.The school may be closed and merged with the school in Offord.
